subject: Re: [junit] testing 'Applets' using either htmlunit or jWebUnit
msgSnippet: ... Additionally, Applets are often Swing applications and so I can run applets without a web browser. Accordingly, I mostly test applets by just running them
messageBody:
Russell Gold wrote:
> HttpUnit has some support for applets. I don't know whether jWebUnit
> exposes it. But applets are ultimately GUIs and suffer from the
> general difficulty of GUI testing.

Additionally, Applets are often Swing applications and so I can run
applets without a web browser. Accordingly, I mostly test applets by
just running them on my desktop.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com
Author, JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
